items.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Sunderland fan Tom A Smith
items.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter and Sunderland fan Tom A Smith - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

items.title: Beestenboel in Ally Pally: Kees Smit aandachtig toeschouwer bij WK Darts
items.summary: Kees Smit brengt een deel zijn vrije dagen met zijn vrienden door. De middenvelder van AZ doet dat verkleed als Shaun het Schaap, tijdens het WK darts in Alexandra Palace.

items.title: VI Live: Zuid-Afrika kan knockout-fase Afrika Cup ruiken
items.summary: Ook maandag wordt er weer gevoetbald in de Afrika Cup. Het Egypte van Mohamed Salah staat tegenover Angola en Marokko treft Zambia. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van maandag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Angola v Egypt: Africa Cup of Nations 2025 ‚Äì live
items.summary: Updates from 4pm kick-off (GMT) in Group B Get in touch: you can email Will about the game The stadium in Agadir looks rather empty. The transfer window is almost upon us. Continue reading...

items.title: Dit vindt Weghorst van de aanstelling van Cruijff bij Ajax
items.summary: Wout Weghorst gelooft erin dat Jordi Cruijff ervoor kan zorgen dat de rust terugkeert binnen de bestuurskamer van Ajax. De spits kent de nieuwe technisch directeur niet persoonlijk, maar denkt dat zijn komst heel belangrijk is voor zijn Amsterdamse werkgever.

items.title: Van de Ven lifts lid on Spurs' hectic 2025
items.summary: It has been a topsy-turvy year at Tottenham Hotspur, with Micky van de Ven lifting the lid on a memorable but ever-changing year at Spurs.

items.title: Maresca bevestigt: Hato mist ook laatste wedstrijd van 2025
items.summary: Voor Jorrel Hato zit 2025 erop. De verdediger van Chelsea raakte anderhalve week geleden geblesseerd. Na de wedstrijd tegen Aston Villa komt ook de afsluiter van het kalenderjaar te vroeg voor Hato.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Slot frustrated over injuries to Liverpool signings
items.summary: Liverpool have yet to get full value from their huge summer spending spree because of the injuries they have suffered, according to head coach Arne Slot.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal 'actively looking' for January deals
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club are prepared to ease their injury problems by "actively looking" at signing new players when the transfer window reopens next month.

items.title: Sources: City in advanced talks for Semenyo
items.summary: Manchester City are in advanced talks to sign Antoine Semenyo, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Aston Villa's 11th straight win might be the most impressive. Plus: Inter must sharpen up
items.summary: Some leagues are on break but the Premier League -- led by Villa's impressive comeback win at Chelsea -- and Serie A are still in full swing. Gab Marcotti breaks down the weekend.

items.title: Ajax laat McConnell per direct terug naar Liverpool gaan
items.summary: Het verblijf van James McConnell bij Ajax blijft beperkt tot een half jaar. De huurovereenkomst met Liverpool gaat ontbonden worden en dus zal de middenvelder (21) teruggaan naar Engeland.

items.title: Lautaro Mart√≠nez continues to do the most difficult thing in firing Inter back to the top
items.summary: The Argentinian captain has his critics but is the leader and inspiration behind a team finding their feet again Leave it to a 20-year-old, with three Serie A starts under his belt, to provide a most perceptive analysis of the Italian top flight as we head into a new year. ‚ÄúThe most difficult thing to do in this game,‚Äù said Francesco Pio Esposito on Sunday night, ‚Äúis to stick the ball in the net.‚Äù He was speaking in praise of his Inter teammate, Lautaro Mart√≠nez, whom he set up for the decisive goal in a 1-0 win away to Atalanta. Pio Esposito had barely entered as a second-half substitute when he was gifted possession by an opponent, Berat Djimsiti. Instead of taking the chance on himself, he froze the last defender and released Lautaro to score with a side-footed through-ball. Continue reading...

items.title: Forest lodge formal complaint over officiating in Man City defeat
items.summary: Nottingham Forest have formally complained about the officiating in their 2-1 defeat to Manchester City in the Premier League.

items.title: Bournemouth target Brennan Johnson as potential Semenyo replacement
items.summary: Tottenham open to doing business for ¬£47.5m forward Semenyo primed to join Manchester City in ¬£65m deal Bournemouth have identified Tottenham‚Äôs Brennan Johnson as a potential replacement for Antoine Semenyo, who is primed to join Manchester City in a deal worth ¬£65m. City are accelerating talks with Semenyo‚Äôs camp and are at the front of the queue to trigger the Ghana winger‚Äôs release clause, inserted last summer when Semenyo extended his contract at Bournemouth. Continue reading...

items.title: No Drama for Nicholls hotpot in Challow Hurdle
items.summary: No Drama This End lived up to his increasingly lofty reputation with a straightforward victory in the Coral Challow Novices' Hurdle at Newbury.

items.title: West Ham to back Nuno in January window
items.summary: Relegation-threatened West Ham are committed to backing manager Nuno Espirito Santo in the transfer market next month.

items.title: Joshua helped from vehicle after fatal car crash in Nigeria
items.summary: Warning: This footage contains distressing scenes. British heavyweight Anthony Joshua is helped from a vehicle - in which he was a passenger - after a fatal car crash in Nigeria. (Pictures:@akinyemiabdulq1)

items.title: 'Domino effect' - Broad warns Ashes inquest could impact Stokes captaincy
items.summary: Stuart Broad has warned that removing ECB managing director Rob Key could trigger a domino effect that puts Ben Stokes' position as England captain at risk.
